description.narrative: Institutional capacities of VNMAC and MOLISA are strengthened to improve in the mine action activities and contaminated communities in Quang Binh and Binh Dinh are cleaner through UXO interventions

- VNMAC capacity to manage/coordinate sector; MOLISA capacity to oversee VA sector; project management capacity of both VNMAC and MOLISA - IMS managed by VNMAC; survivor tracking system managed by MOLISA
- The development and usefulness of website managed by VNMAC personnel; resources mobilized for post-project follow-on activities - Number of ha expected for productive use following release
- Number of MRE programmes/activities implemented. Number of MRE plans approved for application in other localities. - Number of survivors (disaggregated by gender and age-group) in QB and BD with enhanced mobility, earning income and/or engaging in other livelihoods and/or accessing vocational programs, and participating in PwD organizations.

comment.narrative:
- Institutional capacity assessment of VNMAC and MOLISA has never been conducted - IM is currently undertaken in various locations in Vietnam without a unified system under VNMAC
- Website (http://www.vnmac.gov.vn) exists but content is very limited for Vietnamese language part and almost empty for English part - Quang Binh and Binh Dinh’s requested plans for survey and clearance (specific data to be updated)
- Only ad-hoc MRE interventions implemented in QB and BD - Only ad-hoc MRE interventions implemented in QB and BD

• Completion of baseline study to identify baseline, annual targets, measuring indicators and means of verification, Detailed work plan for 2018-2020 with accordingly updated project schedule management, 2018-2020 Procurement plan, Project Handbook, and Communications plan • Completion of staff appointment/recruitment for JPMU
• Survey and Clearance prioritization system, including decision-making criteria approved • Basic training for Survey and Clearance for 230 people from 73 survey/clearance teams completed
• Advanced training on information management and quality management for 10 staff from VNMAC and 2 provincial IM units completed. • Pilot survey of 1000 ha concluded and clearance started. • MRE delivery strategy and action plan, incl. for survey and clearance sites, completed and approved; MRE activities started. • Victim Assistance (VA) baseline survey results and information management system for VA in Quang Binh and Binh Dinh completed. • VNMAC website and 2 provincial information units in Quang Binh and Binh Dinh established.

• Capacity assessment of VNMAC and DSA conducted and 40% of relevant recommendations implemented. • Information management: IM system for KVMAP activities established and managed by VNMAC; PwDs/UXO victims data system (about 80,000 cases) established and managed by DSA/MOLISA; VNMAC website upgraded and regularly updated with at least 200 news.
• Survey & Clearance: Survey of 9,000 ha and Clearance of 1,800 ha • MRE events for the community people in 35 priority communes; MRE events for schoolkids in 35 priority schools; 30,000 children provided with MRE knowledge via formal and informal education activities; 3,000 community people improved MRE awareness and knowledge; 110 pupils creatively deliver MRE messages via televised game shows to attach attention from their peers and public.
• Victim Assistance: 100 UXO/mine victims receive necessary support, including health services, rehabilitation, livelihood, vocational support, etc; 400 social workers, collaborators strengthen their skills of providing care and support for UXO/mine victims; Two social work centers enhanced capacity of providing support for PWDs and UXO/mine victims; A technical guideline from DSA on providing mine/UXO victims issued, which can be applicable for the other provinces throughout the country; Recommendations and comments from MA experts are integrated into the draft law of social work which is under development.

• Capacity assessment of VNMAC and DSA conducted and recommendations are being implemented. • Information management: IM system for KVMAP activities established and managed by VNMAC; PwDs/UXO victims data system (about 75,000 cases of PwDs and 9100 cases of UXO survivors) established and managed by DSA/MOLISA; VNMAC website upgraded and regularly updated
• Survey & Clearance: Survey of 5396 ha and Clearance of 2316 ha • 2 trainings of trainers for 155 key teachers and district managers in Binh Dinh province. Then these trained teachers have facilitated 33 trainings of integration of EORE into curriculum for all school masters of all primary schools and teachers of subjects of “citizen education”, “nature and society”, and “science” at secondary schools throughout the province. After the training, EORE will be routinely integrated into the relevant subjects at different grades at primary and secondary schools. 4 two- day trainings for 175 community communicators who are key persons from Red cross, youth union, military command at communal and district levels were organized in Quang Binh and Binh Dinh provinces. After the trainings, the trained collaborators facilitated EORE awareness events in 50 targeted communes in the two provinces in the remaining of 2019. EORE educational video and audio clips have been continued to be broadcasted in Quang Binh and Binh Dinh from June 2019. The video clip produced for teaching school children about MRE has been posted on the website of the global Safe Ground campaign MRE events for the community people in 35 priority communes; MRE events for schoolkids in 35 priority schools; 30,000 children provided with MRE knowledge via formal and informal education activities; 3,000 community people improved MRE awareness and knowledge; 110 pupils creatively deliver MRE messages via televised game shows to attach attention from their peers and public.
• Victim Assistance: Support services mapping completed.

- Capacity building for mine action administration: o Development of a workplan and implementation of relevant recommendations from the capacity assessment within the timeframe and resource availability of VNMAC and possibly DSA.
o Support on development of circulars on quality management, survey & clearance procedures/standards for Decree 18. - Survey & Clearance:
o Survey of 2,240 ha. o Clearance of 5,140 ha. o Bentic electronic QMS fully operational, providing real-time update from the field for improved planning and informed decision-making. - Information management: o Information management system for KVMAP activities effectively managed by VNMAC; and revision of the KVMAP Information Management Regulations as per Decree 18 and Circular 195. o PwDs/UXO victim data system (about 75,000 individuals) managed by DSA/MOLISA and used for identification and provision of support to relevant target groups among the UXO victims. o KVMAP webpage managed by VNMAC and regularly updated. - Mine Risk Education: o MRE for schoolkids in 116 priority schools and 50 communes. o 75,000 children provided with MRE knowledge via formal and informal education activities. o 10,000 community people improved MRE awareness and knowledge via social media outreach. o 420 pupils creatively deliver MRE messages via televised game shows to attach attention from their peers and public. o MRE sustainable plan prepared and approved upon. - Victim Assistance: o UXO/mine victims receive necessary support, including health services, rehabilitation, livelihood, vocational support, etc. o 300 commune health workers, social workers, collaborators strengthen their skills of providing care and support for UXO/mine victims, including rehabilitation and support for livelihood planning and management.

- Capacity building for mine action administration: o Capacity development plan developed and shared with VNMAC for implementation. This includes supporting VNMAC’s continuing efforts in revision of the QCVN (Technical Regulations), Technical Survey SOP (TS SOP), and Quality Management SOP (QM SOP) following the Decree 18 and circular 195 on mine action.
- Survey & Clearance: o Survey of more than 2,200 ha.
o Clearance of more than 3,000 ha. o Bentic electronic QMS was finalized and handed over to VNMAC for implementation. - Information management: o Information management system for KVMAP activities effectively managed by VNMAC with more than surveyed 16,880 ha and cleared 6,600 ha uploaded on the system; o The KVMAP Information Management Regulations revised for review/comments in the provincial workshops. o PwDs/UXO victim data system managed by DSA/MOLISA and used for identification and provision of support to relevant target groups among the UXO victims. o More than 100 news on KVMAP activities uploaded into the KVMAP webpage. - Victim Assistance: o More than 4,100 UXO survivors in the two provinces received emergency support in response to the COVID-19. o 375 commune, district, and provincial officers were updated about legal documents and policies of supporting the vulnerable populations including UXO survivors and PwDs in response to COVID 19; and community-based rehabilitation skills.
